body_html:
@killeent are you sure the indexing tensor must be a CPU tensor?
torch.FloatTensor(3).cuda()[(torch.rand(3) > 0).cuda()] works fine, whereas

torch.FloatTensor(3).cuda()[torch.rand(3) > 0]
...
TypeError: Performing basic indexing on a tensor and encountered an error indexing dim 0 with an object of type torch.ByteTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars, or if indexing with a torch.cuda.LongTensor or torch.cuda.ByteTensor only a single Tensor may be passed.

pytorch version is 0.3.0.post4

torch.FloatTensor(3).cuda()[torch.rand(3) > 0]
...
TypeError: Performing basic indexing on a tensor and encountered an error indexing dim 0 with an object of type torch.ByteTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars, or if indexing with a torch.cuda.LongTensor or torch.cuda.ByteTensor only a single Tensor may be passed.

pytorch version is 0.3.0.post4
body:
@killeent are you sure the indexing tensor must be a CPU tensor?
`torch.FloatTensor(3).cuda()[(torch.rand(3) > 0).cuda()]` works fine, whereas
```
torch.FloatTensor(3).cuda()[torch.rand(3) > 0]
...
TypeError: Performing basic indexing on a tensor and encountered an error indexing dim 0 with an object of type torch.ByteTensor. The only supported types are integers, slices, numpy scalars, or if indexing with a torch.cuda.LongTensor or torch.cuda.ByteTensor only a single Tensor may be passed.
```
pytorch version is __0.3.0.post4__
